HouseofLords Session 2002 - 03Judgments-Mulkerrins(formerlyWoodward(FC))(Appellant)v.PricewaterhouseCoopers(afirm)(formerlytradingasCoopers&Lybrand)(afirm)(Respondents)HOUSEOFLORDS SESSION 2002-03 [2003] UKHL 41OPINIONSOFTHELORDSOFAPPEALFORJUDGMENTINTHECAUSE Mulkerrins (formerly Woodward) (FC) (Appellant) v . Pricewaterhouse Coopers (a firm) (formerly trading as Coopers & Lybrand (a firm)) (Respondents)ONTHURSDAY 31 JULY 2003TheAppellateCommitteecomprised:
Lord Bingham of Cornhill Lord Nicholls of Birkenhead Lord Millett Lord Lord ScottofFoscote
Lord Walker of Gestingthorpe HOUSEOFLORDSOPINIONSOFTHELORDSOFAPPEALFORJUDGMENTINTHECAUSEMulkerrins(formerlyWoodward(FC)(Appellant)v.PricewaterhouseCoopers(afirm)(formerlytradingasCoopers&Lybrand)(afirm))(Respondents) [2003] UKHL 41

P.SENT: Ms Mulkerrins claims damages from her former professional advisers PricewaterhouseCoopers ("PwC") for having negligently failed to protect her from bankruptcy.
The situation was tailor-made for an individual voluntary arrangement ("IVA").
Ms Mulkerrins consulted insolvency practitioners, Coopers & Lybrand, now PriceWaterhouseCoopers ("PwC").
Mr Rutlen of PwC advised her to apply to the county court for an individual voluntary arrangement ("IVA") under Part VIII of the Insolvency Act 1968.
